oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Billy Sherrill Interviewed by Bob Allen in 1982
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Bob Allen interviewing Billy Sherrill. The recording takes place on 12-22-82.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Billy Sherrill
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:14) -- Beginning of interview with Bob Allen and Billy Sherrill. Billy Sherrill discusses Willie Nelson. (0:47) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about producing for Elvis Costello. (2:24) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about the secret to his success early on. Bob Allen specifically asks about working with Chet Atkins and Owen Bradley. (4:24) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill whether he has been writing as of late. Billy discusses how he doesn't write as much as he used to. "Every session is not do or die anymore." - Billy Sherrill. (6:10) -- Billy Sherrill discusses the influence of Johann Strauss on his writing. "It could be Wagner, it could be Strauss, it could be George Gershwin." (7:01) -- Bob Allen asks about George Jones' vocal range. (7:47) -- Billy Sherrill mentions speaking with Marty Robbins about lowering his vocal range. (10:38) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about whether he worked on changing George Jones' sound. Billy Sherrill discusses how George Jones would alter his performance due to who watched his performance in the studio. (13:50) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about George Jones' contract situation when moving to Columbia. (17:09) -- Bob Allen discusses George Jones moving to Epic Records. (20:16) -- Bob Allen asks about when Billy Sherrill met Sam Phillips. (21:11) -- Billy Sherrill speaks about Sam Phillips' rule of not to over-EQ. "Let it happen. It's got to happen out there in the studio" - Billy Sherrill. (22:25) -- Bob Allen asks about Billy Sherrill's early days of engineering and songwriting.
